description.narrative:
Core support to Civil Society Organisation GenderDoc-M (GDM). GDM is the only LGBT+ organisation in the Republic of Moldova. The support aims to strengthen the organization and contribute to their activities. The core support activities includes the four programs run by GDM.
- The LGBT Rights Lobby and Advocacy Program - The LGBT Community Development Program - The LGBT Health Program - GDM organizational Capacity Building Program
The mission of the organisation is: Creation of a favourable, legal and social Environment within the society for the lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender people by means of developing the LGBT Community, awareness raising, advocating to rights, providing services and building organisation's capacity.

Kärnstöd till den Moldaviska civilsamhällesorganisationen Gender-Doc-M. GDM är Moldaviens enda HBTQ+-organisation. Stödet syftar till att stärka organisationen och bidra till deras verksamhet genom flexibel finansiering som kan användas för både projekt och löpande kostnader för verksamheten. Kärnstödeverksamheten innefattar utvecklande och stärkande av GDM's fyra program:
- The LGBT Rights Lobby and Advocacy Program - The LGBT Community Development Program - The LGBT Health Program - GDM organizational Capacity Building Program
Organisationens syfte är: Skapandet av en bättre juridisk och social miljö i samhället för lesbiska, homosexuella, bisexuella och transpersoner genom utvecklandet av HBTQ+gemenskap, medvetandegörande, rättighetsarbete, erbjudandet av tjänster och kapacitetsutveckling.

participating-org.narrative: NGO Informational Centre Genderdoc-M/A.O. Centrul de Informatii Genderdoc-M

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.
16.10 - Ensure public access to information and protect fundamental freedoms, in accordance with national legislation and international agreements.
16.b - Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development.
16.b - Verka för och genomdriva icke-diskriminerande lagstiftning och politik för en hållbar utveckling.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: Considerable progress has been achieved in `Development of the organization` and improving internal management processes. During the implementation period, the organization had to face various issues related to institutional and legislative barriers, especially in activities designed for `LGBT rights and advocacy programme`. Within different events, group meetings, trainings and psychological counselling, good results were achieved in `LGBT Community Development Programme`. People report violations of their rights, therapeutic sessions are provided, support groups are providing their assistance, trainings with family members were delivered in regions too. In the framework of `LGBT Health Programme`, pre-medical and psychological counselling for beneficiaries was provided. In 2019, GENDERDOC-M extended the work on partnerships and cooperations with other NGOs in the Republic of Moldova. The main goal achieved in 2019 was establishing partnerships with organizations that provide assistance to minors and organizations that support victims of domestic violence. Some important achievements that have to be mentioned are: a more active volunteers` participation, diversification of provided services, a better participation of the internal audit commission. The Volunteering Policy was revised with the direct participation of volunteers and volunteers decided to take responsibility for holding weekly events for LGBT people in the office. The GDM also activates on intersectionality, having it as a basis in organizing informational campaigns and activities. Feminism and women's rights have been a work direction for the last several years. GDM was a co-organizer with other organizations and activists for women's rights of actions on the 8th of March -marches, public discussions, flashmobs. In 2019, 5 events on intersectionality were organized.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
